subject: RE: [junit] How to check the value of one variable in one method in a class in  ajunit testcase..(variable is not returned)..
msgSnippet: thanks for ur response... no i dont hav any getter methods,,,, i think if i include that i can test their values... is thr any possiblity to chk those
messageBody:
thanks for ur response...
no i dont hav any getter methods,,,,
i think if i include that i can test their values...
is thr any possiblity to chk those variables without getter methods...?

"Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@...> wrote:
Are there public getters for con and ps?


________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Archana Subramanian
Sent: Wednesday, March 14, 2007 5:30 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] How to check the value of one variable in one
method in a class in ajunit testcase..(variable is not returned)..



Suppose this is the class to be tested ..

public ResultSet recentSubmission() throws SQLException {
Connection con = null; ResultSet rs=null; try{
Class.forName("sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver");
con=DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:odbc:acme","RIUser","Demo");
PreparedStatement ps= con.prepareStatement("SELECT SUBMISSSION_GUID FROM
SUBMISSION WHERE SUBMISSSION_GUID = 143"); rs=ps.executeQuery(); return
rs; } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } //con.close(); return
rs; }
How to test the connection(con) and preparedStatement(ps)values
in the junit Testcase?
